@wakow
press windows key + r
type in %appdata% and hit enter
rename .minecraft folder to .minecraftbackup or whatever
just make it back to .minecraft to play 1.8

And sorry everyone who asked for getting whitelisted. I cannot whitelist any more ppl because server is already overloaded with current people. But still if you need help with setting up your own server, please feel free to contact me with an email message.

AzDeR@wippies.com
Installer doesn't work with Windows XP 32-bit. Windows XP users must copy the ".minecraft" folder to application data folder, which can be found by pressin Windows key + r and typing in %appdata%

Heya, were having issues with the server. I create my own (quad core/4gb ram/30mbit connection) and my friends get the connection lost error. The server reports a disconnect.overflow error for my friends though I can play there with no problems. I was reading about it and it looks like a game issue but you guys appear to run it fine so what is your secret :) We play through tunngle and i'm using the 2gb server batch file.

@godziothc
I have another computer running minecraft server. Computer has only 512mb RAM and 3GHz 1-core processor. So, the computer is obviously not the reason for this. I am pretty sure the reason is your tunngle. You can simply open your router ports, make server "offline" from server properties file and tell your friends your ip-address. Should work without any problems.

@AdZeRi
